title: Add favicon and app icon assets referenced from HTML head

requirements.summary: Reference favicon assets from the HTML head so browsers show a custom tab icon.
acceptanceCriteria: The browser tab shows a custom icon next to the title when loading the site.
`frontend/index.html` includes appropriate `<link rel="icon" ...>` tag(s) pointing to static image asset(s) served by the frontend.
The favicon works in modern browsers (Chrome, Safari, Firefox) without requiring any backend changes.

file_operations.description: Add `<link rel="icon">` and related head tags to reference the static favicon assets at `frontend/public/assets/generated/dinigc-favicon.dim_64x64.png` and `frontend/public/assets/generated/dinigc-apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png` (include an `apple-touch-icon` link for iOS).

requirements.summary: Add favicon image files as static frontend assets so they are available in build output and can be referenced directly.
acceptanceCriteria: Favicon image files exist under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and are accessible via direct URL paths after build (e.g., `/assets/generated/...`).
`frontend/index.html` references the new favicon asset paths and no broken network requests occur for favicon assets.

file_operations.description: Add the generated favicon asset file so it is served as a static frontend public asset.
Add the generated Apple touch icon asset file so it is served as a static frontend public asset for mobile bookmarks.
